page.title: 18Ash Lagoons Sutton-cum-Lound
page.content: In Sutton there are two ash lagoons. These have been made from old gravel pits that have been deepened and the sides built up. When they have finished digging they sow grass seed on the banks to make them look more natural. The water inside can be up to sixty feet deep. All the ash is piped from Cottam Power Station. Normally it takes lO years to fill them but sometimes it does not take as long as that. The ash looks very solid and safe but really it is very dangerous and is like quick-sand. The sides of the lagoons are very steep and the top is flat. When the ash lagoon is full, they sprinkle soil on and use it to plant things in eventually. Last year the ash froze and the wind blew dust all over Sutton and Lound.
